content:
• Tuesday, February 12, 2013
  • EFC

    Ellington Financial (NYSE:EFC) declares a Q4 dividend of $0.77/share and a special dividend for...

    Ellington Financial (NYSE:EFC) declares a Q4 dividend of $0.77/share and a special dividend for FY2012 of $0.75. The regular dividend is a 10% bump from the previous payout. Kudos go to SA Pro author Thomas Lott who in mid-December highlighted this underfollowed partnership as an alternative investmentÂ idea for mREIT fans. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMCSA

    Comcast's (NASDAQ:CMCSA) $16.7B acquisition, plus its $1.4B purchase of 30 Rockefeller Plaza,...

    Comcast's (NASDAQ:CMCSA) $16.7B acquisition, plus its $1.4B purchase of 30 Rockefeller Plaza, plus $2B in share buybacks, plus a 20% dividend hike which could cost ~$320M/year, is more than enough to burn through $7.9B in free-cash flow it earned for 2012. But CEO Brian Roberts says its balance sheet means the deal isn’t a “big risk." Shareholders don't seem worried; shares +6.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +4.7%) nearly made new highs after CEO Matthew Roberts went on CNBC (video) to...

    OpenTable (OPEN +4.7%) nearly made new highs after CEO Matthew Roberts went on CNBC (video) to tout his company's strong mobile position. Since OpenTable's business revolves around reservations (rather than ad sales), mobile is a "huge positive," Roberts asserts, while adding a third of reservations now come from mobile devices. He also made note of the Foodspotting acquisition. OpenTable rallied last week following its Q4 report, even though it came with light EPS guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM | 1 Comment

    Perceptron (NASDAQ:PRCP): FQ2 EPS of $0.02. Revenue of $13.2M (-18.5% Y/Y) misses by $1.3M....

    Perceptron (NASDAQ:PRCP): FQ2 EPS of $0.02. Revenue of $13.2M (-18.5% Y/Y) misses by $1.3M. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM

    RPX Corp. (NASDAQ:RPXC): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $51.6M (+22% Y/Y) beats by...

    RPX Corp. (NASDAQ:RPXC): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $51.6M (+22% Y/Y) beats by $2.6M. Shares +15% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM
  • MCO

    Moody's (NYSE:MCO) says it's authorized a new $1B share repurchase program. It expects to start...

    Moody's (NYSE:MCO) says it's authorized a new $1B share repurchase program. It expects to start buybacks under the new program once its existing program is complete. The company had $677M of share repurchase authority remaining as of the end of 2012. Shares +0.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM
  • RPXC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RPXC +17%. TRLA +8%. CMCSA +7%. CMCSK +6%. NOG +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RPXC +17%. TRLA +8%. CMCSA +7%. CMCSK +6%. NOG +5%.
    After-hours top losers: RATE -20%. RAX -8%. NAII -8%. CLF -8%. NTGR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • Z

    Trulia (TRLA) now +12% AH following its mixed Q4 report. The real estate site is guiding for Q1...

    Trulia (TRLA) now +12% AH following its mixed Q4 report. The real estate site is guiding for Q1 revenue of $20.8M-$21.2M, above a $19.2M consensus. Marketplace revenue +90% Y/Y to $13.7M, Media (ad) revenue +51% to $6.7M. Monthly unique visitors totaled 23.6M, -5% Q/Q (seasonal weakness) but +50% Y/Y. Mobile monthly uniques totaled 5.8M, flat Q/Q and +119% Y/Y. Total subs +7% Q/Q to 24.4K. Average revenue/sub +12% Q/Q to $172. Sales/marketing expenses +90% Y/Y. 20% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 15, ample fuel for a squeeze. Z +1.1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • DDD

    3D printing plays 3D Systems (DDD -6.4%), Stratasys (SSYS -6.4%), ExOne (XONE -8.5%), and...

    3D printing plays 3D Systems (DDD -6.4%), Stratasys (SSYS -6.4%), ExOne (XONE -8.5%), and Cimatron (CIMT -12.4%) gave back some of their recent gains today. DDD's decline came even though Piper predicted the company would beat Q4 estimates (thanks to strong high-end printer sales) and raise guidance when it reports on Feb. 25. Stratasys reports on March 4.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:20 PM | 9 Comments
  • CMCSA

    Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ:CMCSA): declares $0.195/share quarterly dividend, 20% increase from...

    Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ:CMCSA): declares $0.195/share quarterly dividend, 20% increase from prior dividend of $0.1625. Forward yield 2.00%. For shareholders of record Apr. 03. Payable Apr. 24. Ex-div date Apr. 01. The board plans to repurchase shares of $2.0B during FY13. Shares +7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • GE

    GE +3.4% AH after selling the remaining 49% stake it holds in NBC Universal to Comcast...

    GE +3.4% AH after selling the remaining 49% stake it holds in NBC Universal to Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) for $16.7B; it's also selling related real estate for $1.4B. Expects the pre-tax gain from the sale of ~$1B to be offset by restructuring in 2013. Raised its authorized stock buyback to $35B and plans to buy back $10B worth of shares in 2013. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 6 Comments

    Trulia (TRLA): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $20.6M (+75% Y/Y) beats by $1.61M....

    Trulia (TRLA): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $20.6M (+75% Y/Y) beats by $1.61M. Shares +6.2% AH. (PR)

  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) shares slide further after the company announces a public...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF) shares slide further after the company announces a public offering to sell 9M common shares and 20M of its new mandatory convertible preferred shares. Net proceeds will be used to pay down debt and for general corporate purposes. Shares -7.2% AH. (Q4 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 3 Comments

    Greenway Medical (NYSE:GWAY): FQ2 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $32.7M (+12% Y/Y)...

    Greenway Medical (NYSE:GWAY): FQ2 EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $32.7M (+12% Y/Y) misses by $2.92M. Shares -6% AH. (PR)

  • CMCSA

    Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA): Q4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $15.94B (+6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA): Q4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $15.94B (+6% Y/Y) misses by $20M. Raises dividend by 20%. Plans to buy back $2B in stock in 2013. Acquires GE's 49% interest in NBCU for ~$16.7B. Shares +8.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • RKUS

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Ruckus Wireless (RKUS - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $62M-$64M and...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Ruckus Wireless (RKUS - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $62M-$64M and EPS of $0.03-$0.04 vs. a consensus of $62.6M and $0.03. 2) NetGear (NTGR - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $290M-$305M. below a $317.6M consensus. 3) LivePerson (LPSN - earnings) expects Q1 revenue of $42M-$43M and EPS of $0.06-$0.08 vs. a consensus of $42.2M and $0.08. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $181M-$186M and EPS of $0.30-$0.33 vs. a consensus of $183.4M and $0.37. RKUS -5.7% AH. NTGR -6.4%. LPSN -4.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • CLF

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF) Q4 results: Cut its dividend by 76%, to $0.15/share...

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF) Q4 results: Cut its dividend by 76%, to $0.15/share from $0.625. Full-year 2012 revenues of $5.9B fell 11% Y/Y due to lower seaborne pricing. Increased its 2013 capex budget to $800M-$850M from previous expectation of $700M-$800M due to additional investments in its eastern Canadian iron ore business. Shares -4.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 2 Comments

    Sapient (NASDAQ:SAPE): Q4 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $304M beats by $14.55M. Shares +4.6%...

    Sapient (NASDAQ:SAPE): Q4 EPS of $0.20 in-line. Revenue of $304M beats by $14.55M. Shares +4.6% AH. (PR)

    Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Q4 EPS of $0.62 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $1.54B (-4.2% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)

    Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 in-line. Non-Gaap Revenue of $36.7M (+64%...

    Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD): Q4 EPS of -$0.06 in-line. Non-Gaap Revenue of $36.7M (+64% Y/Y) beats by $1.11M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)

  • LPSN

    LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN): Q4 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $42.5M (+16% Y/Y) beats by $0.8M....

    LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN): Q4 EPS of $0.08 in-line. Revenue of $42.5M (+16% Y/Y) beats by $0.8M. Shares -4.9% AH. (PR)

  • BWLD

    More on Buffalo Wild Wings' (BWLD) Q4: Same-store sales moved up 5.8% at company-owned...

    More on Buffalo Wild Wings' (BWLD) Q4: Same-store sales moved up 5.8% at company-owned restaurants during the quarter and 7.4% at franchise-owned. Elevated wholesale wing prices and the company's rapid pace of expansion contributed to overall costs rising faster than sales. Buffalo Wild Wings issues a warning on Q1, saying for the first six weeks same-store sales dipped 2.8% at company-owned restaurants and 1.7% at franchised locations due to sporting events which didn't line up the same as last year. BWLD -3.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • RKUS

    Ruckus Wireless (NYSE:RKUS): Q4 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $62.2M (+51% Y/Y) beats...

    Ruckus Wireless (NYSE:RKUS): Q4 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $62.2M (+51% Y/Y) beats by $1.74M. Shares -12.3% AH. (PR)

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q4 EPS of $0.89 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $303.8M (+38% Y/Y) beats...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q4 EPS of $0.89 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $303.8M (+38% Y/Y) beats by $11M. (PR). Shares -5.6% AH.

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR): Q4 EPS of $0.55 in-line. Revenue of $310.4M (flat% Y/Y) beats by $2.7M....

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR): Q4 EPS of $0.55 in-line. Revenue of $310.4M (flat% Y/Y) beats by $2.7M. Shares -4.8% AH. (PR)

  • SSKN

    MELA Sciences (MELA -13%) finishes lower today after pricing its 6.1M share public offering at...

    MELA Sciences (MELA -13%) finishes lower today after pricing its 6.1M share public offering at $1.30 per share, a 23% discount to yesterdays close. The company plans to use the funds for its commercial launch of MelaFind.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • RAX

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX): Q4 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $353M (+25% Y/Y) misses by...

    Rackspace (NYSE:RAX): Q4 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $353M (+25% Y/Y) misses by $2.42M. Shares -8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo (GEVO +3.7%) receives a patent for renewable jet fuel blendstock from isobutanol, adding to...

    Gevo (GEVO +3.7%) receives a patent for renewable jet fuel blendstock from isobutanol, adding to the possibility that the company may be on its way to resume production of isobutanol at its Minnesota plant.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • WWD

    Woodward (WWD +1.7%) moves up today after the company highlighted the shipment of its 100,000th...

    Woodward (WWD +1.7%) moves up today after the company highlighted the shipment of its 100,000th OH natural gas engine control system. The system is designed to reduce fuel costs and exhaust emissions in the area of industrial engines fueled by compressed natural gas or liquefied natural gas in heavy-duty transport applications.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • LEA

    Marcato Capital and Oskie Capital say they've sent a letter to Lear's (LEA +1.3%) board...

    Marcato Capital and Oskie Capital say they've sent a letter to Lear's (LEA +1.3%) board outlining concerns around the company's valuation, outlining ideas for potential value-creating initiatives including a capex review, stock buyback, and potential asset acquisitions or sales. LEA, in response, issues a statement reiterating its committment to value creation, noting that it already has an effective investment strategy in place with a flexible balance sheet that enables it to return cash to shareholders.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • FIRE

    Security hardware stocks rally on expectations Pres. Obama will issue an executive order meant...

    Security hardware stocks rally on expectations Pres. Obama will issue an executive order meant to bolster government spending on cybersecurity following tonight's State of the Union. Intrusion prevention system leader SourceFire (FIRE +8.8%), which received 28% of its sales from the U.S. government in Q3, is the biggest winner, but Fortinet (FTNT +4.3%), Check Point (CHKP +1.2%), and Palo Alto Networks (PANW +1.1%) are also higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 3 Comments
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (IDCC -1.9%) slumps after announcing: 1) An ITC hearing about a 3G patent...

    InterDigital (IDCC -1.9%) slumps after announcing: 1) An ITC hearing about a 3G patent infringement complaint levied against Nokia, Huawei, and ZTE has commenced 2) The ITC's Office of Unfair Import Investigations Staff is only involved with 2 of the 7 patents InterDigital is asserting in the complaints (unlike prior complaints, where it covered all issues), and that the staff didn't support the company's stance on those 2 patents in ts pre-trial position. InterDigital's Q4 report is due on Feb. 20.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • BMY

    Shares of Bristol-Myers (BMY -0.7%) slide after a federal judge rules a U.S. patent for its...

    Shares of Bristol-Myers (BMY -0.7%) slide after a federal judge rules a U.S. patent for its hepatitis B treatment Baraclude is invalid, saying there's clear and convincing evidence that a key claim in the patent is invalid due to obviousness. The ruling opens the door to Teva Pharmaceutical (TEVA +0.4%) selling a competing generic copy. BMY says it's disappointed in the ruling and plans to appeal.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • ACHV

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI +1.4%) trades up today after saying it's initiating Phase 2...

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI +1.4%) trades up today after saying it's initiating Phase 2 clinical studies to evalutate OGX-427, a treatment for patients with advanced metastatic bladder cancer. The study is sponsored by Hoosier Oncology Group.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN +1.2%) says the USPTO has granted a Notice of Allowance for patent protection of...

    Amarin (AMRN +1.2%) says the USPTO has granted a Notice of Allowance for patent protection of its Vascepa, a prescription grade omega-3 fatty acid that can help reduce triglyceride levels in adults. The issued patent would have a term that expires no earlier than in 2030.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • XRSC

    Midday top 10 gainers: XRSC +35%. RSOL +31%. STEM +24%. ZIOP +19%. AVP +19%. AMRI +18%. OSBC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: XRSC +35%. RSOL +31%. STEM +24%. ZIOP +19%. AVP +19%. AMRI +18%. OSBC +16%. DQ +14%. MAS +13%. GILT +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: KVHI -11%. ATAI -11%. LVLT -11%. CLSN -10%. RBPAA -10%. MELA -10%. RVLT -10%. CBMX -10%. QLYS -9%. APRI -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CYCC

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC +1%) says it's received patents in the U.S. and Europe for a...

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC +1%) says it's received patents in the U.S. and Europe for a combination treatment of sapacitabine, the company's lead product candidate, with HDAC inhibitors. The patents provide exclusivity until June 2029 and December 2027 respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • GFI

    As the "new" Gold Fields (GFI +1.5%) and its Sibanye Gold (NYSE:SBGL) spinoff begin trading in...

    As the "new" Gold Fields (GFI +1.5%) and its Sibanye Gold (NYSE:SBGL) spinoff begin trading in the U.S. and South Africa, J.P. Morgan rates the new GFI at Outperform, as the unbundling of Sibanye "will allow management to focus on growing production and returns from its existing mines... as well as from its exploration and project pipeline, without the distraction of managing the very different legacy mines."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 3 Comments
  • TTM

    Tata Motors (TTM +4.9%) revs higher after the company reports a 32% increase in global sales for...

    Tata Motors (TTM +4.9%) revs higher after the company reports a 32% increase in global sales for January. The gains were broad from the auto manufacturer with China (+74%), the U.K. (+33%), and North America (+24%) pacing the gains. Sales of Land Rover vehicles set records for the month in the U.K. U.S., and Germany.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMRI

    Albany Molecular Research (AMRI +18%) surges after its FQ3 easily blows out estimates this...

    Albany Molecular Research (AMRI +18%) surges after its FQ3 easily blows out estimates this morning. Contract revenue was $59.1M, up 50% from the prior-year period with sequential revenue improvement in Discovery and Large Scale Manufacturing services. Contract margin jumped to 18% from 2% in the prior-year period. The company also forecast an upbeat Q4, now expecting an EPS of $0.08 - $0.12, better than the Street view of $0.06.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • RTW

    New York & Co. (NWY +10%) soars after increasing its estimates for Q4 as it reports that it...

    New York & Co. (NWY +10%) soars after increasing its estimates for Q4 as it reports that it drew a positive response to its holiday product assortment. Based on an estimate of comparable store sales growth of 2.3%, Q4 revenue is now pegged at $287M vs. $275.6M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • SHW

    Valspar (VAL -7.9%) takes a hit after its FQ1 missed analysts estimates this morning. Net...

    Valspar (VAL -7.9%) takes a hit after its FQ1 missed analysts estimates this morning. Net earnings slipped a surprise 1.3% Y/Y on flat revenue out of its its key coatings segment and a decline in paint revenue. The paint and coatings maker lowered earnings estimates for the year as well, citing weak demand in its key international markets. It now expects to earn $3.60 to $3.80 versus previous estimates for $3.65 to $3.85 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • LDK

    Another day, another big rally for heavily-shorted solar stocks (TAN +3%). Hopes are growing the...

    Another day, another big rally for heavily-shorted solar stocks (TAN +3%). Hopes are growing the beleaguered industry might finally be bottoming: Credit Suisse's Satya Kumar is encouraged by flattening polysilicon and module pricing, and thinks U.S. and Chinese solar initiatives could drive growth. However, he adds "excess panel capacity in China needs to be permanently retired." LDK +9.3%. SCTY +8.3%. GTAT +5.1%. DQ +7.2%. SOL +7.9%.Â  JKS +6.5%. FSLR +2.9%. (yesterday: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 5 Comments
  • MAS

    Masco (MAS +14%) jumps today after its Q4 easily topped Street estimates. Losses narrowed as the...

    Masco (MAS +14%) jumps today after its Q4 easily topped Street estimates. Losses narrowed as the building products supplier racked up better sales across all its segments and stronger operating revenue. CEO Tim Wadhams notes that the company expects strong growth in new home construction this year, along with modest growth in repair and remodeling.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • STR

    Questar (STR -2.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at UBS, which notes much to like about the...

    Questar (STR -2.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at UBS, which notes much to like about the company, but shares are up ~21% YTD and catalysts the firm had outlined earlier plus upside potential of the pending pipeline strategic review are now well understood by the market. At current levels, STR's risk/reward profile has moderated, the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • RGLD

    Royal Gold (RGLD +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at UBS, which notes RGLD's share price...

    Royal Gold (RGLD +3.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at UBS, which notes RGLD's share price has declined by 9.6% in the last month as uncertainty remains over Mt. Milligan and Pascua-Lama. Given the share price drop and after revising its model to reflect FQ2 results,Â the firm cuts its rating and price target given the implied return.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • RXN

    Industrial-parts maker Rexnord (RXN +4.2%) moves up despite posting disappointing FQ3 numbers....

    Industrial-parts maker Rexnord (RXN +4.2%) moves up despite posting disappointing FQ3 numbers. Net earnings rose 64% Y/Y despite lower revenue, as its bottom line benefited from fewer charges. Additionally, the company says it's initiated a review of strategic alternatives, including a possible sale of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • MHRCQ

    In its latest operations update, Magnum Hunter (MHR -1.7%) sets its 2013 capex budget at $300M,...

    In its latest operations update, Magnum Hunter (MHR -1.7%) sets its 2013 capex budget at $300M, and offers 2013 exit rate production guidance of 23K-25K boe/day, a 24%-35% Y/Y growth rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • SPH

    Suburban Propane Partners (SPH +1.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at BofA, which sees the...

    Suburban Propane Partners (SPH +1.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral at BofA, which sees the potential for a resumption in distribution growth as SPH realizes synergies from the acquisition of Inergy's retail propane assets. The firm thinks SPH's current yield of 8.5% does not accurately reflect its growth potential, improving balance sheet and expected lack of equity issuance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • AMD

    AMD's (AMD +3.2%) SeaMicro unit has nabbed Livestream as a customer. The live events hosting...

    AMD's (AMD +3.2%) SeaMicro unit has nabbed Livestream as a customer. The live events hosting site has deployed SeaMicro's ultra-dense SM15000 server platform to handle video transcoding and collaboration services, and touts the platform's space and power savings. The SM15000, also supported by Rackspace, was built with the needs of Internet companies doing hyperscale deployments in mind. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • BYD

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -1.6%) trails off after Goldman Sachs tags the gaming company with a Sell...

    Boyd Gaming (BYD -1.6%) trails off after Goldman Sachs tags the gaming company with a Sell rating and sets a $5.50 price target on shares. The firm thinks the recent runup in share price due to enthusiasm over online gambling in New Jersey may be overdone and warns on the "weak" U.S. gaming market. Also a concern, as a regional player Boyd Gaming is more susceptible to increased cannibalization with new casinos opening up.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • BWP

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP -2.9%) is downgraded to Underperform at Credit Suisse, which...

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (BWP -2.9%) is downgraded to Underperform at Credit Suisse, which believes BWP's modest distribution growth outlook, re-contracting headwinds and likely equity issuance to alleviate a relatively highly levered balance sheet leave it wanting when compared to other opportunities within the MLP sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • UNIS

    Unilife (UNIS -5.5%) takes a hit this morning despite beating FQ2 bottom line estimates late...

    Unilife (UNIS -5.5%) takes a hit this morning despite beating FQ2 bottom line estimates late yesterday. The developer and commercial supplier of injectable drug delivery systems reported an adjusted Q2 loss of $0.12 per share, versus the $0.13 loss per share that analysts were expecting, but revenues came in at just $700K compared with $900K for the same period last year, and below the Street view of $2.01M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • BWLD

    Earnings alert: Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD +1.6%) doesn't report earnings until after the close...
